Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Caerin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli B (MIC=25 µM), Enterobacter cloacae (MIC=50 µM), Klebsiella pneumoniae (MIC=25 µM);Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus haemolyticus (MIC=50 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial and antiviral peptides that adopt an alpha helical conformation which can disrupt bacterial membranes. Each caerin displays a different antimicrobial specificity (By similarity).

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from hylid and ranin frogs originated from a 150-million-year-old ancestral precursor with a conserved signal peptide but a hypermutable antimicrobial domain.
Literature.Author: Vanhoye D, Bruston F, Nicolas P, Amiche M.

Literature.Title: Host-defense peptides of Australian anurans. Part 2. Structure, activity, mechanism of action, and evolutionary significance.
Literature.Author: Bowie JH, Separovic F, Tyler MJ.
